introduction:
Introduction
In this programme, Sam and Neil talk about ways to manipulate the weather. You’ll hear

vocabulary.example: I didn't need an umbrella for the drizzling rain outside.

vocabulary.definition: trying to change something which is not your responsibility
vocabulary.example: Stop meddling in my personal affairs!

vocabulary.definition: acting as if you control everything and can do whatever you want
vocabulary.example: The dictator was accused of playing God with his citizens' lives.

vocabulary.definition: a reason you give to explain why you did something wrong
vocabulary.example: His excuse for being late was that his car broke down.

vocabulary.definition: something that increases then decreases over time
vocabulary.example: Public interest in the new technology waxed and waned over the years.

vocabulary.definition: a subject that is avoided for social or religious reasons
vocabulary.example: In some cultures, discussing death openly is considered taboo.
